-------------------------------1206942343
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi,
 
I had tried running Heritrix-2.0.0 in windows a few days back and had faced  
the same problem.
Since Heritrix-2.0.0 comes with integrated JMX control, hence the system  
requires the jmx password by default. 
 
This however is not the case in Linux wherein one can run Heritrix-2.0.0  
without configuring the JMX  password. 
 
In case you still want to run the Heritrix-2.0.0 from windows, create a  file 
called jmxremote.password and type in the JMX user name and password  
therein. Place the file in the HERITRIX_HOME directory. The template of the  file can 
be seen in  <JAVA_HOME>\jre\lib\management\jmxremote.password.template
 
Also not every heritrix2.0.0 build available from the website seemed to  
work. I am currently using heritrix-2.0.0-20080220.023905-129-dist.zip which  does 
work for windows (XP).
 
Do let me know if this solves your problem or not.
 
regards
 
Pratyush Banerjee
S/W Engineer
AOL India Pvt. Ltd.
India 
 
 
In a message dated 3/27/2008 11:35:32 A.M. India Standard Time,  
yangsongxs@... writes:

 
 
 
I tried to run heritrix.cmd script in the bin directory,but I get the  
followint error Message:

WARNING: It's currently not possible to  run Heritrix in background
on Windows. It was just started minimized in a  new Window
and will be shut down as soon as you log off.

2008-03-27  Thursday 11:44:35.21 Starting heritrix

Heritrix failed to start  properly. Possible causes:

- another programm uses the port for the web  inferface (8080 default)
(e.g. another Heritrix instance)
- permissions  problem with the JMX password file.

Do you want to try to fix the  permissions (Y/N)?

Home.      
(http://home.aol.com/diy/home-improvement-eric-stromer?video=15&ncid=aolhom00030000000001)
